author: admin_l6ma5gus
title: Abdelaziz Barrada, former Getafe player, dies at 35
text:
10/24/2024
Updated at 10:18 p.m.
This feature is only for subscribers
Subscribe
This Thursday, Olympique de Marseille confirmed the death of the former Moroccan international at the age of 35. Abdelaziz Barrada former footballer also from Getafe CF according to information from the media ‘Hespress’.
Said newspaper indicated that Barrada’s death had occurred in France and was due to a heart attack. Signed in July 2007 by the Paris Saint-Germain For his lower categories, Barrada ended up four years later in Getafe’s B subsidiary.
With the blue team, he scored eight goals and gave nine assists in his 64 games in the Spanish LaLiga. In the summer of 2013, the Moroccan attacker completed his signing for Al-Jazira and a season later he landed at Olympique de Marseille.
Throughout his career as a professional player, which ended in the summer of 2021, Barrada wore the Gimnàstic de Tarragona shirt on loan during the second half of the 2018/19 season.
